intro: Mikania cochabambana, commonly known as the Andean vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. Mikania cochabambana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential weed in certain regions.
